Using File Version Control

Version control is a way to keep past revisions of files, often source code text files. By implementing version control, you can return to an earlier revision of a file to reclaim code that should not have been removed or to undo the changes that were made in a later revision.

This application makes version control easy and convenient. It enables you to:

  • Track the files that need to be checked in or out.

  • Check files in or out from several project folders in a single operation.

  • Embed version control information in text files for quick and convenient reference.

  • Merge changes when two users modify the same text file.

  • Branch folders and files by creating separate project views.

  • Create promotion states, supported by view labels, to identify groups of files at different stages of the production process.

  • Configure version control options – for example, by requiring working copies of unlocked files to be read-only.
